entries.name: row
entries.desc: Internal data format used to compare equality.

entries.name: new(headers, fields, header_row = false)
entries.desc: Constructs a new CSV::Row from headers and fields, which are expected to be Arrays. If one Array is shorter than the other, it will be padded with nil objects.

entries.name: ==(other)
entries.desc: Returns true if this row contains the same headers and fields in the same order as other.

entries.name: delete_if(&block)
entries.desc: The provided block is passed a header and field for each pair in the row and expected to return true or false, depending on whether the pair should be deleted.

entries.name: dig(index_or_header, *indexes)
entries.desc: Extracts the nested value specified by the sequence of index or header objects by calling dig at each step, returning nil if any intermediate step is nil.

entries.name: each(&block)
entries.desc: Yields each pair of the row as header and field tuples (much like iterating over a Hash). This method returns the row for chaining.

entries.name: field?(data)
entries.desc: Returns true if data matches a field in this row, and false otherwise.

entries.name: field_row?()
entries.desc: Returns true if this is a field row.

entries.name: fields(*headers_and_or_indices)
entries.desc: This method accepts any number of arguments which can be headers, indices, Ranges of either, or two-element Arrays containing a header and offset. Each argument will be replaced with a field lookup as described in #field.

entries.name: has_key?(header)
entries.desc: Returns true if there is a field with the given header.

entries.name: header_row?()
entries.desc: Returns true if this is a header row.

entries.name: headers()
entries.desc: Returns the headers of this row.

entries.name: inspect()
entries.desc: A summary of fields, by header, in an ASCII compatible String.

entries.name: push(*args)
entries.desc: A shortcut for appending multiple fields. Equivalent to:

entries.name: to_csv(**options)
entries.desc: Returns the row as a CSV String. Headers are not used. Equivalent to:

entries.name: to_h()
entries.desc: Collapses the row into a simple Hash. Be warned that this discards field order and clobbers duplicate fields.

entries.name: [](header_or_index, minimum_index = 0)
entries.desc: Alias for: field

entries.name: each_pair(&block)
entries.desc: Alias for: each

entries.name: header?(header)
entries.desc: Alias for: has_key?

entries.name: include?(header)
entries.desc: Alias for: has_key?

entries.name: key?(header)
entries.desc: Alias for: has_key?

entries.name: member?(header)
entries.desc: Alias for: has_key?

entries.name: to_hash()
entries.desc: Alias for: to_h

entries.name: to_s(**options)
entries.desc: Alias for: to_csv

entries.name: values_at(*headers_and_or_indices)
entries.desc: Alias for: fields
